revised_title: The Electron as a Vector Wave: A New Approach to Understanding Electron Properties
tldr: The author proposes a new theory that the electron should be considered as a vector wave with two components, similar to light waves. This theory addresses the limitations of the spinning electron model and provides a better explanation for the doubling of energy levels in atoms. The author also develops general formulae for the intensities of spectral lines and the magnetic moment, and discusses the implications for the motion of electrons in magnetic fields.
